definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to strike while the iron is hot

sentences.english: Motivation comes in short bursts. Act while it's hot.
sentences.chinese: 激勵是以急促爆發的方式到來的，要趁熱打鐵。

sentences.english: Your suggestion, to strike while the iron is hot, seemed a good idea.
sentences.chinese: 你建議趁熱打鐵，這個建議很好。

sentences.english: The Spaniard then focussed on the task at hand, and hoped that the winning mentality would continue against Villa.
sentences.chinese: 貝尼特斯還希望他們能趁熱打鐵再拿下阿斯頓維拉。

sentences.english: Eg. Well, you should strike the iron while it is hot.
sentences.chinese: 如果我是你，我就會打鐵趁熱。

sentences.english: You know that old expression: strike while the iron is hot?
sentences.chinese: 你知道那個古老的表達嗎，乘熱打鐵？

sentences.english: Have you been to my armory?
sentences.chinese: 你有去過我的打鐵鋪嗎？

sentences.english: Container market is carried also strike while iron is hot, lively and extraordinary.
sentences.chinese: 集裝箱市場運輸也趁熱打鐵，熱鬧非凡。

sentences.english: He learned some blacksmithing but had very little formal education.
sentences.chinese: 他曾學習打鐵，但幾乎沒有接受過正規教育。

sentences.english: We must strike while the iron is hot.
Around 20 years ago software engineering was compared to old-time blacksmithing.
sentences.chinese: 大約二十多年前，軟件工程業被比喻成舊時代的打鐵。

sentences.english: I bet your father must be a blacksmith.
sentences.chinese: 我想你爹一定是個打鐵的。

sentences.english: The best time to conduct a customer satisfaction survey is when the experience is fresh in their minds.
sentences.chinese: 進行客戶滿意調查的最佳時間是趁熱打鐵。

sentences.english: Now is the time to strike. The iron could not be hotter.
sentences.chinese: 目前乃趁熱打鐵之最佳時機。

sentences.english: The second day cloud mania wake up, see in the yard LeEr.
sentences.chinese: 第二天雲狂醒來，見到了在院裏打鐵的樂兒。

sentences.english: We should strike while the iron is hot.
If you want to get an advanced degree, you should strike while the iron is hot. (
sentences.chinese: 假如你想取得高學位，就應該打鐵趁熱。

definition: to learn a skill or art
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
venturing from one's thatched hut for the first time (idiom)/young and inexperienced/novice/greenhorn
variant of 策劃|策划[ce4 hua4]
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
